text: Aaron Brown (November 10, 1948 - December 29, 2024) was an American broadcast journalist. He anchored Newsnight with Aaron Brown, CNN's main newscast. He was known for his reporting of the September 11 attacks on the World Trade Center. Before, he worked at ABC News as a weekend news anchor. He was a local television reporter in Seattle before this.Aaron Brown biography, CNN Retrieved 16 February 2015 Brown was a professor of journalism at Arizona State University. Brown was born in Hopkins, Minnesota. Brown died on December 29, 2024 in Washington, D.C. at the age of 76. ==References== Category:CNN people Category:2024 deaths Category:American television news anchors Category:1948 births Category:Arizona State University faculty Category:Journalists from Minnesota Category:Educators from Minnesota
